comments:
I deployed birt.war web application included as a part of birt-runtime-2_1_1. Followed the ditrections regarding deploying birt webApp in WebSphere: setting Class loader policy to parent_last, and copying org.eclipse.emf_2.2.0.v200606051102.jar to lib directory. This happens every time.

Below are the details of the WebSphere runtime:

Which birt build did you use, 2.1.1, 2.1.0 or something else? Did you deploy birt as a war file or a folder to Websphere? Which version of WS did you use, 5 or 6? Thanks!

I used birt-runtime-2_1_1.

1. Imported the brit.war file into a new project in WebSphere Integration Developer 6.0.

2. Copied org.eclipse.emf_2.2.0.v200606051102.jar from plug-in directory in web-ing/lib directory and deleted it from plug-in directory.

3. Deployd the application ear file created by the WebSphere Integration Developer into WebSphere Application Server 6.0.2.15 runtime.

4. Changed the class loader policy of ear to PARENT_LAST
4.1 Changed the classlodare scope to Application

5. Changed the class loader policy of birt web module to PARENT_LAST

Also, when I examined the class loader view of the birt.war application I did not find any jar files from plug-in directory.

You can do simply as the following to deploy birt into WS.
1)Rename 'birt.war' in birt-runtime-2_1_1.zip file to 'birt.ear'
2)Deploy the ear file to WS as normal and then run.

Maybe something is wrong with the documentation in the website.
Assign documentation team to update the constructions.
Please add an entry to BIRT's FAQ wiki page.

(In reply to comment #4)
> Please add an entry to BIRT's FAQ wiki page.
> 

Wenfeng, 
 As you know, we can not correctly access some website for network malfunction. So I can not access eclipse wiki page to add an entry for the deployment issues these days. Maybe defer it to M5? Thanks!

Already has entries for the deployment in WebSphere in http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Birt_WebSphere_Deployment and http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Birt_WebSphere_6.0.0.0_Deployment. However it seems that the constructions are not updated with the birt changes. Assign Documentation to update the two website for the deployments in WebSphere.

I do not have WS so what does the wiki page need to say.

Jason

I don't believe that this is a documentation bug.

I've tried following the documentation at http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Birt_WebSphere_Deployment and
http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Birt_WebSphere_6.0.0.0_Deployment

I'm getting the exact same error that Sastry reported whe I try to deploy to WAS 6.0.2.9.  The app will deploy and I can hit the index page.  Then Null pointer exception in ReportEngineService.setEngineContext when I try to view the report.

Following the deployment advice in comment 4 will not work.  Renaming a war file results in a deployment failure - which should be expected as it's not a valid ear file.

In WAS 6, you can deploy a war file from the console, the server will wrap it up in an ear file during deployment - I've also tried this method and it ends in the same result.

I'm using the 2.1.2 viewer and engine.
Please verify deployment of birt 2.1.3 runtime on WAS 6.0.  and describes the steps.  Thanks
Please verify deployment of birt 2.1.3 runtime on WAS 6.0.  and describes the steps.  Thanks

I followed the instructions: http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Birt_WebSphere_Deployment 
in the section for BIRT WebSphere 6.0.1 Deployment

I am using the 2.1.2 Engine and Viewer.

I downloaded the 2.1.2 source, added some printlns to see where the problem lies.  It's in the OSGILauncher.  Specifically, it's

java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.osgi.service.packageadmin.PackageAdmin: method getBundle(Ljava/lang/Class;)Lorg/osgi/framework/Bundle; not found

It looks like the frameworkClassLoader is correctly loading org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter from the jar file in the Plugin Directory.  It however, makes reference to PackageAdmin - which is picked up in 
eclipse-osgi.jar.  This jar is in the WAS lib directory.  My osgi jar is org.eclipse.osgi_3.2.2.R32x_v20070118.jar

There are multiple eclipse jars in the WAS lib directory - swapping out the OSGI jar file is not a viable option.  

It looks like someone has succeeded in getting 2.2M2 running on WAS:
http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/BIRT_2.2_on_Websphere_6.0.2.0
Maybe I'll try that...

(In reply to comment #11)

> 
> It looks like someone has succeeded in getting 2.2M2 running on WAS:
> http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/BIRT_2.2_on_Websphere_6.0.2.0
> Maybe I'll try that...
> 

BIRT 2.1.3 could also be an option...  You can find it in the daily build section at 
http://download.eclipse.org/birt/downloads/build_list.php  (bottom part of the page).  This version is not released yet, but it is relatively stable.

We have tested BIRT runtime2.1.3 in Websphere 6.0.1 and 6.1.0 and both the deploy and report preview are OK.

The test build is 2.1.3.v20070517

Two option should be set:
1. Change Class load mode to Parent Last. 
2. Change WAR Class load policy to Application. 

BTW, need not to copy org.eclipse.emf_2.2.0.v200606051102.jar

Please download BIRT2.1.3 latest build and have a try.
Is this fix also in 2.2 or is 2.1.3 a separate branch?
Works both for 2.2 and 2.1.3, please have a try.
